newsitem.title: USA: Protective Life to refund $7 mln in premiums.
newsitem.headline: Protective Life to refund $7 mln in premiums.

text.p: Protective Life Corp said on Monday it will make voluntary refunds of $7 million to about 50,000 cancer insurance policyholders, because the advertisements it used were not applicable in 12 states.

Protective Life said its sales materials indicated that any rate increases would be subject to approval by state insurance agencies, which is not the case in 12 states where rates could be increased after merely filing for rate hikes.
On an after-tax basis, the refunds could reach a maximum of about $0.15 a share, president and chief operating officer John Johns said in a telephone interview.
In 38 states other states where the policies were sold, the sales materials were correct, the company said.
